item.title: Happy Histograms
item.description: Up next on the data visualization journey: Histograms! Histograms what people often think of as bar graphs. They show the spread and shape of a single set of data. For our example, let’s look at the weights of MLB players through the Master table in the Lahman database. item.title: Time for Time Series
item.description: Hello again! This time we are going to look at data visualization in the form of time series! A time series is similar to a scatterplot, in the way that it has two sets of data against each other. However, one of those sets of data is time. item.title: Scatterplot Fun
item.description: Here we go on our first adventure in data visualization. Let’s take the homeruns and strikeouts from the Lahman database of baseball statistics and make a scatterplot! First, we need to load our libraries. This tells the computer what sets of data to look at! library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Next, we are going to specify what we are looking for. In this case, career homeruns and strikeouts from players who had more than 400 homeruns.
